utterances.transcript: Well there are some public buses which will take you there.

utterances.transcript: If you are staying near to that particular place you can go there yourself by public transport or you can also pick up their express buses there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can see %uh getting there which I'm gonna click right now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can see these are some the pickup points %uh from the city area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: From the city area means from the nearby area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So since you are staying at Little India the nearest place to pick up will be at Hotel Rendezvous.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Hotel Rendezvous.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh you can just take a walk from your hotel to Hotel Rendezvous it's about another %uh ten minutes you should be at the Hotel Rendezvous.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or otherwise you can also pick up the %uh train system %uh from there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you can see if from here %uh, right.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The MRT station, you can take the MRT towards that area or you can even take the buses from here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can see that the bus service number %um nine two six and nine two seven, nine two six and one seven one.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It is located quite near to your hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can pick up those buses and go to Night Safari also.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh it says here it takes thirty to forty minutes to get there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Correct.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's thirty to forty minutes because the bus need to travel from your area which is the %uh the centre of the Singapore all the way towards the North area It's approximately around about that time, yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How about %um going back, will it be difficult to go back to the hotel right after the Safari tour?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: N~ %um. No. In fact the buses are available until twelve midnight the train system also available until twelve midnight.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you want to- if you would not be able to catch those two you can also catch a taxi which is also available the last mean of transportation to go back, yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But I won't have m~

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And to get a taxi-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I wouldn't have money for taxi.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Don't worry, mostly the taxi fare if it's you are taking taxi probably it will cost you around about %uh thirty five dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh that's expensive.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Right.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But otherwise you can just leave a little bit early just %uh before eleven you can leave.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But usually if you go to Night Safari we usually goes around about five thirty or five P.M. because Night Safari is open at seven but %uh when the drive bus journey takes you there it will be just nice for you to get around to take some nice photograph before the Night Safari opens up the gates %uh for you to view.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So by the time you finish %um your attraction inside Night Safari it should be around about ten.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um it should be fine for you to get %uh to your hotel without any problem.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Ah okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So how long will it take for us to finish the Safari tour?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay that %uh really depends on you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: For a normal person you will finish around about three to- %uh three and a half hours you should be able to get done with it.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So if I want- if we want to go there we will- we should be there before seven right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Correct.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How about other places, what other places can you recommend?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How about %um-

utterances.transcript: Well if you like nature Singapore Botanical Garden will be a nice place to visit.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's actually free of charge.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And from your places to the %um- now I got from your places to that %uh Singapore Botanical Garden

utterances.transcript: there is also a train system available.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you were to see from the map here on the screen itself you'll find Little India at that particular station over there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you take the train system down %uh all the way towards- yah the- %uh sorry.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you take the train system you can also lead towards Botanical Garden.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's quite easy and convenient.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So yah you can take it down all the way towards the %uh Dhoby Ghaut Station change the train up there or you can take the yellow %um the Bras Basah line all the way one round towards the Botanical Garden.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So the train fare approximately I sup~ going to be around about two dollars per person.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So Botanical Garden will be a nice place to visit as well.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is it free of charge?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes Botanical Garden is free.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And of course %uh let me just pull up Botanical Garden for you, alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How about Merlion what does it mean, Matthew?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh right.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh Merlion is actually an icon of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It was only created in nineteen seventy two- the park is created in nineteen seventy two.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The lion head symbolised the %uh founding of the island and of course the fish body just symbolised the humble fishing village.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh that was the reason why we put it together and called it Merlion.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Ah okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Right.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That is a symbol for Singapore, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Ah yes, indeed.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We use that to symbolise Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah there you are, that's the Singapore Botanical Garden and this is- yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is %uh how to get there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can either go by three ways, the MRT which is the circle line which I have told you about just now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can see the yellow line-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: it's very nice.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you also can get %um down by foot from your hotel %uh to take a walk there it is not convenient but you can take a bus directly from your hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are- these buses here you can see via Bukit Timah,

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: that will be the buses available for you to pick up to the Singapore Botanical Garden.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And it opens during the morning five A.M. all the way to twelve midnight.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But %uh if you are visiting Singapore Botanical Garden you should not miss the National Orchid Garden.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's a very nice garden %uh with lots of beautiful flowers.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I guess your daughter and you will be enjoying the photography session inside the National Orchid Garden.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there is a fees for you to pay in order to get admission, again it's five dollars per adults and children have to be below twelve.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Again I need to pay five dollars for her as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Correct.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you are going into the National Orchid Garden.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you are not then the admission for the Botanical Garden is free of charge.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Will it be okay to take photographs or to take our pictures there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes of course.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That's the reason for visiting attraction, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you can take-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But some places it can-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are only- there- Yah there are some places like the Night Safari.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The Night Safari %uh photography is allowed but flash photography is not allowed.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh because during the night time some flash light from the cameras may harm the animal so it may cause the animal to run into danger.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that is the reason why flash photograph are not allowed inside the Night Safari.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh I see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How about from the airport going to the hotel that you're talking about, you're recommending, how long will it take from the airport going to the hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it will approximately about half an hour to forty five minutes, yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So we could take the bus or the train as well?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I will suggest you to take the train it's a lot more easier.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So if we're going to take the train from the airport it will take thirty minutes you said?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah thirty to forty five minutes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because the minute when you %uh get out from the airport the train system from the airport is to this station called Tanah Merah Interchange whereby you have to walk across the other platform to pick up the other train towards to your hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Thirty to for~ How long- How long if you're going to walk it from the airport?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Not it's %uh- from the airport there is a direct train from the airport to the Tanah Merah Interchange which is %um about five minutes of %uh MRT ride, yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh so it will not be difficult to locate-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Not it's la~ and not difficult to locate.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And how much will it cost again from the airport going to the hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: From the airport to the hotel it's approximately about two to three dollars because you need to deposit one dollar additional for the ticket.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It will be refunded to you immediately after you get exit from the train station and get a refund from the machine by slotting in the ticket back into the ticket machine.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It will give you the refund of the deposit of the ticket itself.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Ok~ Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And from the hotel it takes us thirty to forty minutes if we're going to take the train going to Sentosa and Universal Studios right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah inclusive of this waiting time or waiting for the %uh train to come waiting for while you're walking.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that is %uh taking into consideration.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But is it confusing to read your maps or-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No it's quite easy to read our maps.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you see the map here which is on the screen right now.

utterances.transcript: You'll find that the Little India is there that's where your hotel is right?

utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.transcript: Do you remember?

utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah right.

utterances.transcript: So from Little India if you were to see it's quite near to Bugis and Bugis is the one- that is the one that you see on your map it will leads you all the way to Changi Airport.

utterances.transcript: Can you see Changi Airport?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.transcript: On the right hand side which has a number three there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So Changi Airport has %um a train system which will lead to Tanah Merah you can see Tanah Merah there and that is an interchange that you have to change a train just by walking across the platform.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It will takes you all the way down %uh towards the %uh what you call, %uh the Bugis area where you can walk towards your hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Your hotel is in between Little India and Bugis.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's quite near, you don't have to worry.

utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's near.

utterances.transcript: And that's the o~ Changi is it?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Changi?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes %uh Changi Airport.

utterances.transcript: Changi Airport is the only airport that you have, international airport?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We- Yes, this is the international airport.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We do have three airport but this is the only airport which %uh have %uh flights coming in from- %uh passenger flights coming in.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The other airports are mainly for military use and also meant for private jets and not for big %uh passenger aircraft.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: and one more thing, what do you suggest %uh should I reserve or my booking online on a- if I'm going to stay in the hotel and- or-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.transcript: And from the hotel there's a lot of places if we're going to walk it we won't get hungry, right?

utterances.transcript: %Uh no definitely not.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You- there's a lot of %uh food court, coffeshops are available, restaurants are also available so %uh don't worry.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Ah okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And-

utterances.speaker: Guide
